title: Test scores comparison
description: Use a bar chart to display the average test scores in different subjects across schools, with 'plum' for Mathematics, 'lightcoral' for Science, and 'khaki' for English.
solution:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px

colors = {'mathematics': 'plum', 'science': 'lightcoral', 'english': 'khaki'}
df.plot(kind='bar',stacked=False,color=[colors[col] for col in df.columns],figsize=(12,8))

plt.title('Average TEst Scores in Different Subjects Across Schools')
plt.xlabel('School')
plt.ylabel('Average Text Score')
plt.legend(title='Subject')
plt.grid(axis='y')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.show()
